Cardiff.
                                                                       –3–                                         M18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


     Question                                         Answers                                                       Notes                     Total
1.     a    i    molar mass of urea « 4  1.01  2  14.01  12.01  16.00»  60.07 «g mol1» ✔ Award [2] for correct final answer.
                               2  14.01                                                         Award [1 max] for final answer not to
                 «% nitrogen             100 » 46.65 «%» ✔                                   two decimal places.                            2
                                 60.07



1.     a    ii   «cost» increases AND lower N % «means higher cost of transportation per unit of   Accept other reasonable explanations.
                 nitrogen»
                                                                                                   Do not accept answers referring to
                 OR                                                                                safety/explosions.                           1

                 «cost» increases AND inefficient/too much/about half mass not nitrogen ✔

1.     b                                  Electron geometry          Molecular geometry            Note: Urea’s structure is more complex
                                                                                                   than that predicted from VSEPR theory.
                         Nitrogen              tetrahedral ✔          trigonal pyramidal ✔                                                      3
                          Carbon           trigonal planar ✔             trigonal planar

1.     c         n(KNCO) « 0.0500 dm3  0.100 mol dm3»  5.00  103 «mol» ✔                     Award [2] for correct final answer.
                                                                                                                                                2
                 «mass of urea  5.00  103 mol  60.07 g mol1»  0.300 «g» ✔

1.     d    i
                 Kc 
                        (H N) CO  H O ✔
                          2   2       2
                                                                                                                                                1
                          NH   CO 
                              3
                                  2
                                      2


1.     d    ii   «Kc» decreases AND reaction is exothermic
                 OR
                 «Kc» decreases AND H is negative                                                                                              1
                 OR
                 «Kc» decreases AND reverse/endothermic reaction is favoured ✔

                                                                                                                                         (continued…)

(Question 1d continued)

      Question                                                  Answers                                   Notes                    Total
 1.     d    iii                G À             50  103 J                            Accept range of 20-20.2 for M1.
                   ln K «                                            »  –20 ✔
                                 RT         8.31J K 1 mol1  298 K                     Award [2] for correct final answer.


                   «Kc » 2  10–9
                                                                                                                                    2
                   OR
                   1.69  10–9
                   OR
                   10–9 ✔

 1.     e    i     Any one of:                                                           Accept “urea has larger size/greater
                                                                                         van der Waals forces”.
                   urea has greater molar mass ✔
                                                                                         Do not accept “urea has greater
                   urea has greater electron density/greater London/dispersion ✔         intermolecular forces/IMF”.                1
                   urea has more hydrogen bonding ✔
                   urea is more polar/has greater dipole moment ✔

 1.     e    ii                                                                          Award [1] for each correct interaction.
                                                                                         If lone pairs are shown on N or O, then
                                                                                         the lone pair on N or one of the lone
                                                                                         pairs on O MUST be involved in the
                            ✔
                                                                                         H-bond.
                                   ✔                                                     Penalize solid line to represent           2
                                                                                         H-bonding only once.
                                                                       –5–                                         M18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M



     Question                                         Answers                                                       Notes                Total
1.     f        2(H2N)2CO (s)  3O2 (g)  4H2O (l)  2CO2 (g)  2N2 (g)                                                      3
                                                                                                   Accept (H2N)2CO (s)      O2 (g) 
                correct coefficients on LHS ✔                                                                              2
                                                                                                   2H2O (l)  CO2 (g)  N2 (g).           2
                correct coefficients on RHS ✔
                                                                                                   Accept any correct ratio.

1.     g                 0.600 g
                «V                     22700 cm3 mol–1  » 227 «cm3» ✔                                                                  1
                       60.07 g mol1

1.     h        lone/non-bonding electron pairs «on nitrogen/oxygen/ligand» given to/shared with
                metal ion ✔
                                                                                                                                          2
                co-ordinate/dative/covalent bonds ✔

1.     i        lone pairs on nitrogen atoms can be donated to/shared with C–N bond
                OR
                C–N bond partial double bond character
                OR                                                                                                                        1
                delocalization «of electrons occurs across molecule»
                OR
                slight positive charge on C due to CO polarity reduces C–N bond length ✔

1.     j        60: CON2H4 ✔                                                                      Accept “molecular ion”.
                            
                44: CONH2 ✔
                                                                                                                                          2

     Question                                         Answers                            Notes                  Total
1.     k          3450 cm1: NH ✔                                     Do not accept “OH” for 3450 cm–1.
                                                                                                                 2
                  1700 cm1: CO ✔

1.     l    i     1✔                                                                                             1

1.     l    ii    singlet ✔                                            Accept “no splitting”.                    1

1.     l    iii   acts as internal standard                            Accept “inert” or “readily removed” or
                  OR                                                   “non-toxic” for M1.
                  acts as reference point ✔


                  one strong signal                                                                              2
                  OR
                  12 H atoms in same environment
                  OR
                  signal is well away from other absorptions ✔

     Question                                           Answers                                     Notes                      Total
2.     a         electrostatic attraction AND oppositely charged ions ✔                                                         1

2.     b         multiply relative intensity by «m/z» value of isotope              Award [1 max] for stating “m/z values of
                                                                                    isotopes AND relative
                 OR
                                                                                    abundance/intensity” but not stating
                 find the frequency of each isotope ✔                               these need to be multiplied.
                                                                                                                                2
                 sum of the values of products/multiplication «from each isotope»
                 OR
                 find/calculate the weighted average ✔

2.     c         «promoted» electrons fall back to lower energy level ✔             Accept “Na and Ca have different
                                                                                    nuclear charge” for M2.                     2
                 energy difference between levels is different ✔

2.     d    i    Any two of:
                 stronger metallic bonding ✔
                 smaller ionic/atomic radius ✔


                 two electrons per atom are delocalized
                                                                                                                                2
                 OR
                 greater ionic charge ✔
                                                                                    Do not accept just “heavier” or “more
                                                                                    massive” without reference to atomic
                 greater atomic mass ✔
                                                                                    mass.

2.     d    ii   delocalized/mobile electrons «free to move» ✔                                                                  1

                general increase ✔

                                                                         of values above 7 and below 14.          1

     Question                                         Answers                                     Notes                Total
2.     g    i    sigma ():                                                     Award marks for suitable diagrams.
                 overlap «of atomic orbitals» along the axial/internuclear axis
                 OR
                 head-on/end-to-end overlap «of atomic orbitals» ✔
                                                                                                                       2
                 pi ()
                 overlap «of p-orbitals» above and below the internuclear axis
                 OR
                 sideways overlap «of p-orbitals» ✔

2.     g    ii   sigma (): 3
                 AND                                                                                                    1
                 pi (): 2 ✔

     Question                                       Answers                                             Notes                          Total
3.     a    i    nickel/Ni «catalyst» ✔                                                Accept these other catalysts: Pt, Pd, Ir,
                                                                                       Rh, Co, Ti.

                 high pressure                                                                                                     2
                                                                                       Accept “high temperature” or a stated
                 OR                                                                    temperature such as “150 ºC”.
                 heat ✔

3.     a    ii                                                                         Ignore square brackets and “n”.
                                                                                       Connecting line at end of carbons
                                                                                       must be shown.                                   1

                                                   ✔

3.     b         ethyne: C2H2  Cl2  CHClCHCl ✔                                      Accept “C2H2Cl2”.

                                                                                                                                        2
                 benzene: C6H6  Cl2  C6H5Cl  HCl ✔

3.     c    i    H Ö  bonds broken  bonds formed ✔                                  Award [2] for correct final answer.
                                                                                       Award [1 max] for “+525 «kJ»”.
                 «H Ö  3(CC)  6(C C)benzene / 3  839  6  507 / 2517  3042 »
                 525 «kJ» ✔
                                                                                       Award [1 max] for:                               2
                                                                                       «H Ö  3(CC)  3(CC)  3(CC) /
                                                                                       3  839  3  346  3  614 / 2517 
                                                                                       2880 » 363 «kJ».

(Question 3c continued)

      Question                                         Answers                                            Notes                Total
 3.     c    ii    H Ö  Hf (products)  Hf (reactants) ✔                           Award [2] for correct final answer.
                                                                                         Award [1 max] for “+635 «kJ»”.         2
                   «H Ö  49 kJ  3  228 kJ » 635 «kJ» ✔

 3.     c    iii   Hf values are specific to the compound
                   OR
                   bond enthalpy values are averages «from many different compounds» ✔
                                                                                                                                2
                                                                                         Accept “benzene is in two different
                   condensation from gas to liquid is exothermic ✔                       states «one liquid the other gas»”
                                                                                         for M2.

 3.     c    iv    «∆SÖ  173  3  201  » 430 «J K1» ✔                                                                     1

 3.     c    v     T  «25  273 » 298 «K» ✔                                            ∆Gϴ < 0 may be inferred from the
                                                                                         calculation.
                   ∆Gϴ «  635 kJ  298 K  (0.430 kJ K–1)»  507 kJ ✔                                                       3
                   ∆Gϴ  0 AND spontaneous ✔

 3.     d          equal CC bond «lengths/strengths»                                    Accept “all C–C–C bond angles are
                                                                                         equal”.
                   OR
                   regular hexagon
                   OR                                                                                                           1
                   «all» CC have bond order of 1.5
                   OR
                   «all» CC intermediate between single and double bonds ✔
                                                                         – 12 –                                    M18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M



     Question                                         Answers                                                       Notes                   Total
4.     a        Any two of:                                                                         Do not accept “disappearance of
                                                                                                    calcium carbonate”.
                loss of mass «of reaction mixture/CO2» ✔
                                                                                                    Do not accept “gas bubbles”.
                «increase in» volume of gas produced ✔
                                                                                                    Do not accept “colour change” or          2
                change of conductivity ✔                                                            “indicator”.
                change of pH ✔
                change in temperature ✔

4.     b    i   reaction is fast at high concentration AND may be difficult to measure accurately
                OR
                so many bubbles of CO2 produced that inhibit contact of HCl (aq) with CaCO3 (s)
                OR
                insufficient change in conductivity/pH at high concentrations
                OR
                                                                                                                                              1
                calcium carbonate has been used up/is limiting reagent/ there is not enough
                calcium carbonate «to react with the high concentration of HCl»
                OR
                HCl is in excess
                OR
                so many bubbles of CO2 produced that inhibit contact of HCl (aq) with CaCO3 (s) ✔

                                                                                                                            1




                  straight line going through the origin AND as close to A, B, C as is reasonably
                  possible ✔

(Question 4b continued)

      Question                                  Answers                               Notes                Total
 4.     b    iii   «directly» proportional ✔                       Accept “first order” or “linear”.
                                                                   Do not accept “rate increases as
                                                                                                            1
                                                                   concentration increases” or “positive
                                                                   correlation”.

 4.     b    iv    rate  k [H] ✔                                 Accept “rate  k [HCl]”.                 1

 4      b    v     0.02 ✔
                                                                                                            2
                   s1 ✔

 4.     c          20.5  10–3 «mol dm–3 s–1»                      Accept any answer in the range
                                                                   19.5–21.5.                               1
                                                                      – 15 –                   M18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


     Question                                            Answers                                Notes                    Total
4.     d        ALTERNATIVE 1:
                carry out reaction at several temperatures ✔
                       1
                plot       against log rate constant ✔
                       T
                Ea = – gradient  R ✔                                                               Ea
                                                                               Accept “gradient             ” for M3.
                                                                                                      R
                ALTERNATIVE 2:
                carry out reaction at two temperatures ✔                       Award both M2 and M3 for the formula
                                                                                                                          3
                                                                                  rate1 Ea  1 1 
                                                                               ln           .
                                                                                  rate2 R  T2 T1 
                determine two rate constants
                OR
                                                                               Accept any variation of the formula,
                determine the temperature coefficient of the rate ✔                                 Ea  1   1
                                                                                       rate1       
                                                                                                 R T T
                                                                               such as        e  1 2.
                                                                                       rate2
                                     k1 E a  1 1 
                use the formula ln            ✔
                                     k 2 R  T2 T1 
                                                                         – 16 –                                     M18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


     Question                                         Answers                                                        Notes                  Total
5.     a        slower rate with ethanoic acid                                                      Accept experimental observations such
                OR                                                                                  as “slower bubbling” or “feels less
                                                                                                    warm”.
                smaller temperature rise with ethanoic acid ✔


                [H] lower                                                                                                                   2
                OR
                ethanoic acid is weak
                OR
                ethanoic acid is partially dissociated ✔

5.     b        Any one of:                                                                         Accept “lowering pH of
                                                                                                    oceans/lakes/waterways”.
                corrosion of materials/metals/carbonate materials ✔
                                                                                                                                             1
                destruction of plant/aquatic life ✔
                «indirect» effect on human health ✔

5.     c        Brønsted–Lowry base:
                NH3  H  NH4 ✔
                                                                                                    Accept “AlCl3 as an example of Lewis
                                                                                                    acid”.                                   2
                Lewis base:
                                                                                                    Accept other valid equations such as
                NH3  BF3  H3NBF3 ✔
                                                                                                    Cu2  4NH3  [ Cu(NH3)4 ] 2.

5.     d
                [H] «   K a  [C5H10O2 ]    9.333  106  0.010 »  3.055  104 «mol dm3» ✔   Accept “pH  3.52”.
                                                                                                    Award [2] for correct final answer.      2
                «pH » 3.51 ✔
                                                                                                    Accept other calculation methods.
                                                                  – 17 –                                    M18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


     Question                                        Answers                                                 Notes                    Total
5.     e        (CH3)3CCOOH (aq)  OH (aq)  (CH3)3CCOO (aq)  H2O (l)                   Accept “HA” for the acid.

                OR                                                                          Award [1 max] for correct
                                                                                            explanations of buffering with addition
                (CH3)3CCOOH (aq)  OH (aq)  (CH3)3CCOO (aq)  H2O (l) AND addition of    of acid AND base without equilibrium
                alkali causes equilibrium to move to right ✔                                equations.

                                                                                                                                       2
                (CH3)3CCOO (aq)  H (aq)  (CH3)3CCOOH (aq)
                OR
                (CH3)3CCOO (aq)  H (aq)  (CH3)3CCOOH (aq) AND addition of acid causes
                equilibrium to move to right ✔

     Question                                                Answers                                                Notes                 Total
6.     a        salt bridge ✔


                movement of ions                                                                                                           2
                                                                                                   Do not accept “to complete circuit”
                OR
                                                                                                   unless ion movement is mentioned for
                balance charge ✔                                                                   M2.

6.     b        Positive electrode (cathode):                                                      Award [1 max] if correct equations
                                                                                                   given at wrong electrodes.
                Ag (aq)  e  Ag (s) ✔
                                                                                                                                           2
                Negative electrode (anode):
                Mg (s)  Mg2 (aq)  2e ✔

6.     c        in external wire from left to right ✔                                                                                      1

6.     d        «E  0.80 V  (2.37 V)  » 3.17 «V» ✔                                                                                   1

6.     e                                0.10 g                                                     Award [2] for correct final answer.
                «moles of silver                   1
                                                         »
                                     107.87 g mol
                                           0.5  0.10 «g»
                moles of magnesium                               ✔                                                                        2
                                         107.87 «g mol1»

                                                    24.31 g mol  0.5  0.10 g
                «loss in mass of magnesium                                       » 0.011 «g» ✔
                                                             107.87 g mol1
                                                                     – 19 –                                   M18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


     Question                                        Answers                                                  Notes                     Total
7.     a        Any two similarities:                                                        Do not accept “produces alcohol” or
                heterolytic bond breaking                                                    “produces NaCl”.

                OR
                chloride ions leave ✔
                nucleophilic/OH substitution ✔
                both first order with regard to [halogenoalkane] ✔


                One difference:
                CH3CH2CH2CH2Cl is second order/bimolecular/SN2 AND (CH3)3CCl is first
                order/unimolecular/SN1                                                       Accept “substitution in 1-chlorobutane
                                                                                             and «some» elimination in 2-chloro-2-       3
                OR                                                                           methylpropane”.
                CH3CH2CH2CH2Cl rate depends on [OH] AND (CH3)3CCl does not
                OR
                CH3CH2CH2CH2Cl is one step AND (CH3)3CCl is two steps
                OR
                (CH3)3CCl involves an intermediate AND CH3CH2CH2CH2Cl does not
                OR
                CH3CH2CH2CH2Cl has inversion of configuration AND (CH3)3CCl has c. 50 : 50
                retention and inversion ✔

7.     b        C–Br bond weaker than C–Cl bond ✔                                            Accept “Br  is a better leaving group”.
                                                                                             Do not accept "bromine is more
                                                                                             reactive".                                  1
                                                                                             Do not accept “C–Br bond is longer
                                                                                             than C–Cl” alone.
                                                                        – 20 –                   M18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


     Question                                        Answers                                      Notes                      Total
7.     c    i     butan-1-ol/CH3CH2CH2CH2OH ✔                                    Do not accept “butanol” for “butan-1-ol”.
                                                                                 Accept “1-butanol”.
                                                                                                                              1
                                                                                 Do not penalize for name if correct
                                                                                 formula is drawn.

7.     c    ii    «reduction with» lithium aluminium hydride/LiAlH4 ✔            Do not accept “sodium
                                                                                                                              1
                                                                                 borohydride/NaBH4”.

7.     c    iii   ester ✔                                                                                                     1
